summary: Being a Land and Water	Management engineer by profession, Koen Overkamp worked, before his move to New Zealand, as teamleader and senior programme manager at the Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP).	Besides leading the Africa and Middle-East team at NWP, Koen was also secretary to	the Egyptian-Dutch High Level Water Panel and managed the bilateral delta cooperation programme with Egypt. In addition, he was liaison officer for a number of multilateral organizations as part of the ‘Finance for Water’ team at NWP. Before joining NWP, Koen worked for more than 10 years for the United Nations on various water related programmes in Egypt, Indonesia and the USA.

profile_positions.description:
Since I started working as an independent consultant, I have been engaged in the following assignments:
- Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and Water: Senior advisor to the project team that is responsible for  organizing the UN 2023 Water Conference.
- The Netherlands Enterprise Agency: Senior advisor to the Egytian - Netherlands High Level Panel on Water Management. This include preparing and organizing panel meetings and project development. 
- Supporting a tender process of a large climate development programme financed by the Dutch Government.
- Promoted closer collaboration and knowledge exchange between the New Zealand water sector and the Dutch Water Sector. This work included an assessment of the New Zealand Water Sector.  
Participated as a water and agriculture expert in the Dutch Risk Reduction Team to Fiji to assess flood risks and potential solutions for two catchment areas. 
- Presented a lecture about urban development in water scarce countries to students from the Hogeschool Rotterdam.

profile_positions.description:
Project:	United Nations Secretary-General’s Advisory Board on Water and Sanitation (www.unsgab.org)

Tasks:	
- The organisation and substantial preparation of biannual meetings of UNSGAB.
- Preparation of visits, dossiers and speeches for the Chair of UNSGAB, HRH the Prince of Orange. 
- Providing substantial and logistical support to the UNSGAB working groups on financing and

profile_positions.description:
Project:		Special Programme for Food Security in Indonesia

Tasks:	
- Technical and operational support to the national project management unit of the Special Programme 
   for Food Security.
- Designing a capacity building programme for farmer groups in managing their water and land 
   resources.
- Establishing a Monitoring and Evaluation programme. 
- Preparing project proposals, progress reports and guidelines.
- Secretary to the donor coordination group for the water resources sector in Indonesia. 
- Providing technical support to the National Planning Agency of Indonesia (Bappenas) throughout a 
   reform process in the water resources sector in Indonesia and the adoption of a new water law.
- Coordinator post-tsunami damage- and need assessment for the water and agriculture sector in Aceh, 
   Indonesia. 

Achievements:	
- A well functioning and motivated multi-disciplinary project management team. 
- Thirty five farmer groups formed and trained in managing their water resources.
- A concise and workable monitoring and evaluation system designed.
- Two progress reports and guidelines drafted for the implementation of a food security programme in 
   Indonesia.
- In coordination with the Indonesian government donor coordination meetings for the water resources 
   sector monthly organized.
- The set up of online database for all water resources related projects and programmes in Indonesia.
- Presentation of the first damage- and need assessment of the agricultural and water resources sector 
   for the tsunami affected area in Aceh, Indonesia.
